column4: i droped the file exactly there (/usr/lib/opera/plugins/) and i restarted opera but when i open icq.com there will be a message please install macromedia flashplayerplugin
is that where opera says it expects to find plugins?
in about: plugins in opera does it show you have flash?
you can also put it in ~/.opera/plugins
i believe
how about in /usr/lib/flashplugin-nonfree
there s no such dir..
make it
you can also try: /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins or /usr/lib/firefox/plugins
if you use symbolic links instead of actually copying the file, you will save space
ok (but i copy it normally im new in ubuntu and dont know what symbolic links are...)
i copied it to /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins/ but the error message comming again...
its like a shortcut in windows, but the shortcut will act just like the file is there but takes up zero extra space on the disk
ok but it didnt solve my problems...
is there a way to find out if the .so file had the right header??
file /path/to/file
is your ubuntu 64bit? is the opera you have installed 64bit?
falk@falk-desktop:~/Programme$ file libflashplayer.so
ive installed ubuntu 64 and opera 64
thats not the 64bit plugin dude.
do you have the right file? can you send it to me?
http://download.macromedia.com/pub/labs/flashplayer10/libflashplayer-10.0.32.18.linux-x86_64.so.tar.gz
THAT is the 64bit file
you will need to delete ALL the others you have copied. history | less    will help
